name: Telescope Words A-Z Quiz Series - L | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.text:
I will give you three clues.  You must solve the three clues, and type in JUST the first answer, that begins with L.  The first clue will be a word that begins with L.  The second will drop the L for another word, and the third drops the first letter of that word to form one more word.  For instance, if I give you "Beverage - Hockey arena - Pen fluid", you would solve the clues and get "Drink - Rink - Ink".  But you would ONLY type the word "Drink" in the answer field.  Are you ready?  Get set... GO!

This clue is special, as it will have four clues.

Camel-like alpaca relative - Buddhist priest - American Medical Association (abbrev.) - Mother
questions.explanation:
Llama.

	Llama - Lama - AMA - Ma Thanks PDAZ for this clue.  And a special shout out to all Llamas out there.

questions.text: Stroke with a whip - Cinders - Quiet!
Traditional beliefs - Mineral bearing rock - Prefix meaning again, or preposition meaning concerning
Many louses - Frozen water - Common Era (abbrev.)
Care of horses for payment - Ellen Pompeo's husband Chris, or footballer Eddie Lee - Muchly
Unit of bread - Stupid person - Military branch abbrev.

This is another with four clues!

Machine that holds and turns wood or metal so it can be shaped - Association for Theater in Higher Education (abbrev.) - Definite article - That man
Green citrus fruit - Program that allows user to input symbols not found on the input device - Myself, I
questions.explanation:
Lime.

	Lime - IME - Me IME stands for Input Method Editor.  This is especially helpful when inputing symbols from different languages when using an English keyboard.

questions.text: Somewhat unsatisfactory - Religion opposed to electricity (mostly) - Mix of things; _ Mash
Light beer - One who gets older (so, everyone) - Heartburn abbrev.
questions.explanation:
Lager.

	Lager - Ager - GER GER stands for gastroesophageal reflux, which is not as bad as it sounds.  It is simply acid reflux, which is a common cause of heartburn.
